story:
We would like to present the " StooLove " for desk 2.0

It comes with a wi-fi charger

 

 

You can have the mini-StooLove desk on your desk at work and feel your favorite fragrance! You can put on it your phone, pens...whatever you wish. It is an actual real little StooLove, a piece of furniture built from solid oak.

Measures

You can have mini-StooLove desk hand-dyed with natural oil or with fragrant essential oil. The essential oil we have chosen will not only perfume the environment around you but will also support your wellness. You can have mini-StooLove desk treated with lavender, patchouli and sandalwood.

 

 

StooLove is not a stool, or rather not only…SLove is a multifunctional piece of forniture that can fit for any kind of location…

StooLove is made up of two overlapping hearts, one can be used as a seat and the other one can be used as a shelf or as a comfortable relaxing place for your feet. The two hearts are connected by legs that give them balance, harmony and stability and make SLove…a strong heart.

SLove is a stool….is a shelf….is a small table!

Handcrafted by the skilled hands of Italian craftsmen, SLove is a product with a simple and attractive design, that makes it a classy piece of forniture; "a furniture" that can be carried around thanks to its comfortable, side or main, leather or natural hemp handle. Built from solid oak, StooLove is dyed with a natural oil pad, and, as a possibility, with fragrant essential oil.

StooLove: model LS 

It is made with a leather side handle, which is 5 cm high and 2.5 mm thick, with rolled edges. The handle is hand-sewn with a resin thread. It also has four leather feet that are perfectly hand-applied in their recesses

These sophisticated details make StooLove a piece of furniture which is able to enhance any location

You can choose the leather details in three different colors: brown - red - green

StooLove: model LC

It is made with a leather main handle, which is 5 cm high and 2.5 mm thick, with rolled edges. The handle has metal balance weights which allow the handle to go back in its place when you use SLove

 

You can choose the leather in three different colors: brown - red – green

 

StooLove: model TC

This is made with a 100% pure hemp hand-dyed side handle. The fabric is made in Italy, in the district of Turin, by careful and expert hands, respecting the environment.

You can choose the hemp handle in three natural colors: red (scarlet) - yellow (mignonette) - blue (indigo blue), dyed by immersion and brushing.

Measures

StooLove is completely hand-made:

from it’s structure….

to it’s details.

StooLove is a unique item numbered with the bulin engraved technique.

The number of the stool and the date of its creation show our passion and make StooLove an unforgettable memory.

You can have StooLove hand-dyed with natural oil or with fragrant essential oil.

The essential oil we have chosen will not only perfume the environment around you but will also support your wellness.

You can have StooLove treated with:

  • Lavender essential oil for your relaxation and for a peaceful sleep
  • Patchouili essential oil to enhance your energy and your concentration
  • Sandalwood essential oil to meditate and heal emotional and spiritual sufferings

Every single piece is branded with the logo Benvegnù, a historic Italian craft brand.

to make your SLove even more unique and special, we can engrave your initials or anyonelse you wish.

 

In addition you can add an elegant packaging in cotton, the BIG BAG, to your SLove.

The BIG BAG comes only and solely with the LS model. It’s not only a packaging, but also a comfortable and roomy bag, with hand-sewn leather, in the same color of the StooLove you choose.

 

TEAM

SPECIAL THANKS

ANDREA MANTOVANI - "THE VIDEOMAKER" 

ALESSANDRO TRICOMI - "THE HERO TRAINER"

TIMELINE

 REWARDS

 LOVE KEYRINGS

You can have Love KeyRings treated with:  

Lavender essential oil for your relaxation and for a peaceful sleep 

Patchouili essential oil to enhance your energy and your concentration  

Sandalwood essential oil to meditate and heal emotional and spiritual suffering        

You can choose color leather detail: red-green-brown.

StooLove... a piece of furniture made with LOVE.

Thank you for your SUPPORT!!!

Risks and challenges

Given the 20 year's experience of one of the creators within the forniture's designer, the feasibility of the project is with no risk. Unique difference could be due to the difference amount of StooLove to be produced as we currently can only produce one StooLove a day. However we will costantly keep you updated about both, production and expedition.

story:
Ellipso - The Age of Robots 

Ellipso is our first home robot design, where we combine state of the art robotic research and technology with very affordable pricing. We, at FRACH robotics, believe the robotic revolution will only help us, when the robots are affordable to all of society and especially to their most vulnerable parts. 

We need Your help to deliver this new and exciting technology to the World! And we want You to be the first to have access to this technology, the Age of Robots.  

 

 

Ellipso is an autonomous intelligent home robot, which is always online, listening to you and ready to execute your requests or just connect you with your loved ones.  The robot implements an animal like brain model, so it behaves almost like it is alive. Ellipso is also integrated with Google Assistant, Google Drive, Google Mail, YouTube and Microsoft Skype to let you stay in touch.

Ellipso design brings a large display to not only show just the robot's face, but also to show useful content on the screen, such as Google Assistant, YouTube or Skype. The robot is actively listening to all sounds and it automatically reacts to your verbal commands. Currently only English, but we will support other languages in the future.  

Ellipso comes with different personality profiles, faces and voices. But it is also fully customizable, if you are more on an artistic side. Ellipso remembers requests of different family members and also what happened in the past, so it behaves and provides specific feedback based on the situational and historical context.

Ellipso robot design includes the latest deep neural network frameworks for object and face detection to recognize you, your pets and other objects in your house. The robot uses optical recognition algorithms for understanding its location and map of your house, so it knows where is a kitchen, obstacles or a fall. Ellipso has also plenty of environmental sensors to fully understand what is happening in your house, such as people movements, sounds or alarms.  

 

Robot Behavior

The robot's role is not to replace your friends or pets, but rather to make your life easier. The robot will help you to stay in contact with your loved ones and automate tedious and boring tasks in your house.

Our robot products come with these default behavior tasks so you can specifically instruct them, at home or remotely, to focus on the right job:

  •  Personal companion - the robot will follow you in your house or look at you on a desk, ready to execute your commands. The robot will greet you from time to time and share the latest status with you. 
  •  Calling over Skype - you can ask the robot to call a person on Skype; from home or remotely. Or the robot will call you if it sees anything suspicious. 
  •  Search and share a message - you can remotely ask the robot to find your loved one (person or pet) in the house and deliver a message or take an action.
  •  Taking a picture - ask your robot to take a picture for a memorable moment and store it in the Google Cloud.
  •  Going somewhere - you can ask your robot to go to a specific room (e.g. a kitchen) and take an action there. 
  •  Google Assistant -  just ask the Google Assistant any tricky question you want. From weather to politics to science; or just for a joke.  
  •  Youtube - you can ask your robot to play Youtube content of your choice.
  •  Sharing the latest status - the robot will tell you how long you have been gone and what happened in your house in the meantime.
  •  Sharing the latest weather info and news - every morning and when asked the robot will share with you the latest local weather forecast and news.
  •  Teaching a foreign language -  the robot will teach you a foreign language, using simple, but effective active recall method. We start with Spanish, but more languages are coming. 
  •  Setting an alarm - ask your robot to wake you up when it is the right time. 
  •  Playing with pets - your pets can get a bit bored when they are left alone or perhaps you want to chat with them over Skype. Just ask your robot to be a messenger or entertainer. 
  •  Securing the property - be better safe than sorry. Our robots can watch your house for you when you are away and alarm you if they detect any suspicious sounds, movements or a human presence. Our robots store all the taken evidence in the Google Cloud and call you on Skype, so the bad guys will have a bad day whatever they do.  
  •  Robot administration - creating its own map of rooms and obstacles; watching its battery status and automatically recharging when due; or just endlessly waiting for you to come back.

Please do not worry if you are missing anything here. We will be releasing new functionality every 3 months. And we are going to listen to you on social media and our user forums to really understand your new requirements.  

 

Robot Customization

We, at FRACH robotics, understand that key to any successful product is a high level of customization for specific user needs and demands. We are all different and unique and therefore we require the same from our tools and gadgets. Our robotic technology supports comprehensive customization in both appearance and behavior. Our technology also supports user provided customization from our more DIY and artistically oriented customers.  

  •  Robot call name - the default robot call name is "COMPUTER", but feel free to change it to anything else.
  •  Robot personality profile customization - our robots come with plenty of different personality profiles so you can have fun every day: FRIEND, MEDIEVAL, TEENAGER, SERVANT, MILITARY, SCI-FI, ROMANTIC and obviously also your custom one. 
  •  Robot face customization - out of the box we provide 9 different faces for our robots, but feel welcome to upload your own creative designs.

  •  Robot voice -  you can chose tens of different voices, male/female speakers and different English accents. Later on our robots will also support other languages. 
  •  Robot behavior - you can customize hundreds of behavioral rules, how often the robot should interact with you or what particular activities to be temporarily disabled. 
  •  Face recognition - using the face recognition technology the robot is able to respond to each user with his/her own name and related history.   
  •  Tyres - we will provide a rich selection of internal/outdoors tyres with different colors, so you can take your robot out on a garden and do some "digging".

 

Robot Models

Our robot products come in 3 models to let our customers to choose the right tool for the job:    

 

Privacy and Security

We, at FRACH robotics, consider the security and privacy as the most important functionality of our products. It is paramount that your personal data are comprehensively protected as our robots are present in your homes. 

Our technology use strictly only secure publicly available services from major SW providers for all robot external communication. Such as Google Android OS, Google Drive, Google Android Voice Recognition, Google Mail and  Microsoft Skype. There is no other robot communication with our company servers or any other 3rd parties. Users are also able to explicitly disable any robot interfaces such as camera or microphone for maximum privacy. 

 

Robot App

 Obviously our robots will come with an app, both Google Android and Apple iOS.  

The app will enable you to connect and use your robot, when you leave your house. You can check the status of your robot, what action it is currently executing, its position in the house, see details of any security alerts and use the live Skype video/audio feed. Also it could be more comfortable to use the app to configure the robot's settings, instead of typing on the robot's screen or talking to it. 

 

Robot Design 

  • External shapes - Ellipso design is inspired by using a single geometrical shape (the ellipsoid) for the whole body and wheels, so the end result has a simple, but powerful and elegant impression.  
  •  Robot SW design - The robot's main control process is implemented as an Android long running background Service. The Service's thread cycles every 100ms and it implements integration with all external modules; such as camera, BlueTooth or Android's speech recognition API. The external modules translate their specific custom events to a generic logical language so the robotic brain model can simply analyse and command the robot based on the historical context and current events.  
  •  Robot brain model -  our robot brain cortex behavioral rules model is based on the “Affordance Competition Hypothesis” research of University of Montreal. This enables the robot to behave like it is alive and us to simply add new rules and behavior with minimal impact on the current ones. The same way a child would learn new behavioral patterns. 

  •  Robot Android AI frameworks - Google TensorFlow Lite deep neural networks for object detection (20 class yolo); Google FireBase ML framework for face/expression detection; OpenCV open sourced framework for face recognition. 
  •  Robot HW AI frameworks - HW accelerated Kendryte K210 deep neural network object detection and sound FFT to detect specific sound patterns (e.g. human voice or a fire alarm). 
  •  Robot SLAM mapping and navigation - "Fast Semi-Direct Monocular Visual Odometry" algorithm with IMU support to detect 3D obstacles and falls  based on research of University of Zurich; simultaneous localisation and mapping (SLAM) algorithm for robot's self-navigation and map generation.
  •  Robot HW capabilities - Android ARM quad/octa core 1300/2000 MHz CPU for high level cognitive behavior and integration with Cloud services; Kendryte K210 dual core 400/600 MHz CPU with dedicated deep neural networks HW acceleration (TensorFlow Lite) and FFT acceleration; ESP32 dual core 240 MHz CPU for Bluetooth, UART and GPIO connectivity. 
  •  Robot Android APIs - robot SW functionality and its behavior is tightly integrated with Android available public APIs and services. Such as Google Android Speech Recognition API; Google Android TextToSpeach API; Google Assistant and Google Youtube integration; Google Drive as Cloud based document storage; Google Mail as Cloud based communication API; Microsoft Skype as Cloud based IM service. 
  •  Robot sensors - 32/16/5MPx upward and 2MPx downward facing two cameras; GPS satellite position detection, two microphones with HW accelerated FFT; two 3W speakers; two Doppler radar modules for movement detection; red 5mW laser pointer, 3W RGB LED lights, 3W white LED lights, 6 DoF IMU with gyros and accelerators. 
  •  External connectivity - WiFi, Bluetooth, Android Cloud APIs. Our robots require only a standard Internet connectivity to access Google Mail, Google Drive and Microsoft Skype. No requirement to reconfigure your home or office WiFi routers to expose the IP ports or any other hassle. 
  •  SW API dependency - our robots are only dependent on publicly available free Google and Microsoft APIs. Therefore, there is no risk to the robots functionality if anything happens to our company servers.    
  •  Online SW updates - the robot's Android application (including its main behavioral rules and external interfaces) will be online updated every 3 months for new functionality and bug fixes; using Google Play market.   
  •  No monthly charges - there are no monthly or other charges for using our robots. Have a fun and enjoy the robot every day.
  •  Self-charging - our robots automatically monitor status of their batteries and when the charge is low the robot will automatically locate and recharge itself in a docking station. The robot can operate about 4h on a single charge when actively working; about 12h on standby with radar movement detection enabled.       
  •  Obstacle and voids detection - when on a table or facing down a staircase the robot will automatically detect dangerous voids (using the visual odometry algorithm) and reverse back. 
  •  User replaceable batteries - users can simply replace the robot's 18650 Li-ion batteries with minimal effort (2 x 2800mAh 18650 Li-ion cells). The batteries should last about 1 year if you use the robot every day.     
  •  4x4 all wheel drive - all wheel drive is a necessary design choice to support good locomotion across long hair carpets, floor bumps and clothing left on floor.
  •  Noise suppression - geared motors generated noise will be significantly reduced by 3 levels of sound insulation: geared motors rubber enclosure, rubber belt transmission to wheels and rubber tires.   
  •  DIY customization and hacking SDK - our robots comprehensively broadcast their status using Android Intents to support integration with the 3rd party custom applications and hacks. So you can extend the robot's behavior for your own custom actions and integrate it with your apps.  

  

Our Products Pipeline

The plan below shows our product pipeline for next 3 years. Ellipso, Barrel and Globe robots are our generic designs; Blocker (compatible with major brick play-sets), Froggy and Cubby robots are models for children; and in 2022 we want to introduce our first soft robot Gripper and also a robot drone FastAir. 

 

Delivery Timeline

It has been a long journey, but now we, at FRACH robotics, have a great and exciting technology ready to be shared with You:

 

Total Quality Control

We, at FRACH robotics, are obsessed with quality control of our products. Based on the IT industry DevOps best practices the continues multi-level testing with fully automated 24/7 regression is necessary to deliver stable, functional and long-term reliable products. Majority of the automated test cycles will run at least every 24h and each identified defect will be required to be fixed immediately.

 

Functional behavioral testing - unit testing of the brain behavioral rules in JVM to assure a proper sequencing and habituation of the behavioral actions; unit testing of interface modules in JVM; virtual functional testing of the assembled robot in the virtual environment; environmental functional testing in real habitats.

None-functional electronic testing - unit testing of the off-the-shelf electronic modules (e.g. geared motors) before assembly; power consumption, endurance and self-charging testing; electronic interference testing. 

None-functional mechanical testing - unit testing of mechanical parts before assembly; mechanical functional stress, falls, vibrations and endurance testing; noise generation testing on different surfaces. 

User acceptance testing - testing the robot behavior and user interactions with small focus groups to assess simplicity, effectiveness and usability of the robot's user interfaces; both vocal and screen UIs.

 

Small Scale Production

Small scale production of electronic gadgets has been always a concern for its high investment and operational costs. For example, the high-quality steel plastic injection molds for a small robot can easily cost upto £100000. Therefore we, at FRACH robotics, have developed the SASS (Smart Agile Small Scale) method to minimize the costs, focus on fast delivery of the business value to our customers and risk mitigation at it's core. Our SASS method covers comprehensively all aspects of design, manufacturing, testing and fulfillment and it is strongly inspired by the IT industry best practices such as Agile, DevOps and Micro-services.  

 

  • 3D design - using inexpensive 3D CAD SW, such as FreeCAD or AUTODESK Fusion 360.
  •  Off-the-shelf HW design - component design based on reusing currently manufactured and easily sourced modules such as Android devices, geared motors, common DIY electronic modules, rubber transmission belts, etc. Focus on sourcing from multiple channels to minimize dependency risks and costs.   
  •  Off-the-shelf SW design - robot SW functionality and its behavior is tightly integrated with Android available public APIs and services. Such as Google Android speech recognition API, Google Android TextToSpeach API, Google Assistant, Google Youtube, Google Drive, Google Mail and Microsoft Skype. This design approach significantly extends robot's capabilities, but reduces the costs. 
  •  Rapid prototyping - using FDM 3D printers with 0.8mm nozzles for fast and 0.4 nozzles for more precise plastic parts prototyping; with PLA plastic for low environmental impact and recyclability. 
  •  Rapid mold patterns - using SLA/DLP 3D printers with UV resins to achieve high quality mold patterns with 50 microns resolution.
  •  Rubber plastic injection molds - using RTV silicone and thermoplastic PVC rubbers for inexpensive and recyclable injection molds; reinforced with fiberglass threads. 
  •  Aluminium plastic injection molds - using inexpensive aluminium mold production technique based on the sequence: SLA 3D printed mold pattern / rubber mold / refractory plaster mold / vacuum assisted melted aluminium mold; where the aluminium molds can be also used directly in the plastic injection molding machines. Also with the benefit of aluminium recycling.  
  •  Polyurethane plastics - low viscosity vacuum assisted injection molding without expensive injection molding machines for low production volumes. Adding chopped glass fibers for extra strength, durability and crack resistance.
  •  Outsourced plastic injection molding - renting local available capacity and using low cost aluminium molds for standard plastic injection molding for medium production volumes.
  •  Outsourced electronic PCB manufacturing and assembly - using online outsourced services, where a PCB is manufactured, assembled and delivered in 4 weeks. See bellow an example from our main PCB manufacturing partner; Seeed Studio.
  •  Self-assembling design - designing both plastic and electronic PCB parts to simplify, mechanically guide and speed up the assembly of the final product with focus on mitigation of wrong direction/parts assembly. 
  •  Batch assembly - using mass production techniques introduced by H. Ford to break down complex assembly processes to tens of simple assembly steps, which can be executed in batches of 100s. 
  •  ISO quality - quality method focused on reproducibility, where the assembler is provided with visual and video description of each simple assembly step and with all required assembly tooling. So, the assembly batch is executed in the continuously same quality and productivity. 
  •  SW Agile, DevOps and Micro-services - using the IT industry SW development best practices to continuously analyse, develop, test, deploy and assess business feedback in short monthly cycles. Breaking down complex SW packages to small components with defined interfaces to simplify, parallelize and de-risk the SW development. Totally automating repeatable processes, such as build, test and deploy.
  •  Agile delivery of the business value - iteratively deliver the latest functionality and bugfixes to the customer base every few months over the Internet.    
  •  Outsourced fulfillment - outsourcing fulfillment of the end product to global efficient professionals to minimize costs and environmental impact. Prefer local over global.  
  •  Customer feedback - support multi-channel customer feedback on social media and forums to truly understand customer wishes, desires and new trends. Involving the customer base in selection of new functionality, capabilities and products. Running small focus groups for simple and inexpensive product marketing research and product capabilities assessment. 
  •  Research & development - staying on the top of the latest University research and following the latest open sourced technologies from major SW companies. 

 

Prototyping

Agile delivery methods require a short iteration life-cycle of analyses, design, test, user feedback and improvement. It is necessary to innovate, test and accept/reject all parts of the design in fast and fine granular matter to maximize business value, mitigate delivery, quality and user acceptance risks and minimize the development, production and product costs. On the picture below you can see history of our prototyping cycle for last 2 years.  

 

Research & Development

We, at FRACH robotics, are fascinated with a prospect of having inexpensive humanoid robots at our homes. However to achieve this goal we need to first develop animalistic type of robot locomotion and also inexpensive and human safe robot muscles. As we are closely following the latest university research in these areas we believe we can develop our first soft-robot product (Gripper) in next 2 years. 

Utrecht University and University of British Columbia research of muscle based control with neural delay to simulate bio-mechanical constraints: 

Google DeepMind AI research of walking bi-pods using self-learning deep neural networks: 

Cornell University research of soft robotic muscles:

Harvard University research of small soft robots:

 

FRACH Robotics Team

We are a robotic start-up focused on advanced autonomous robotic technologies to be present in our homes. Turning our technology dreams into main stream consumer products. We believe that with Your help we can start the robotic revolution and take the human kind to next level ... the Age of Robots.

 Damian Frach MSc, MBA - founder, business and technical strategy; product development; design, development and manufacturing processes; logistics; programme management

 Katerina Frach BSc - founder; market research; product marketing; customer community development; quality assurance; customer care; fulfillment; finance and accounting

 Jerome Josephraj BSc - adviser; Entrepreneurship; Java Enterprise technologies; Cloud; full SW development life-cycle; Agile and DevOps delivery methods; test-driven and behavior-driven SW development

 Jonas Allemann MSc - adviser; advanced mathematics, 3D modelling and visualizations; simultaneous localisation and mapping

 Jack Cowling MSc - adviser; advanced mathematics; artificial intelligence; deep neural networks

 

Risks and Challenges

Capital Investment - mitigated by our small scale production SASS delivery method, which enables small and medium manufactures to avoid high investment costs in tooling and machinery.

Design complexity - mitigated by using off the shelf SW , HW and mechanical modules in our designs. Significant reduction of complexity and costs and improvement of reliability and quality of our products.

Sourcing - mitigated by using off the shelf modules from multiple manufactures and sale channels to avoid single point of failure in our sourcing. Sourcing competition also significantly reduces the costs.

Quality - mitigated by continues 24/7 test automation of all aspects of functional and none functional scope. This enables 100% daily regression quality assurance and detection of any long term issues.

Privacy, security and dependency - mitigated by using only Google and Microsoft public Cloud services with no dependency or content share with FRACH robotics servers.

Product functionality - mitigated by listening to our customer base on the social media and our forums for new requirements, trends, issues and concerns. Releasing new functionality every 3 months.

 

Environmental Commitments

Long-lasting design - Reinforced plastic parts, regular online SW updates and user replaceable batteries assure our products life-span is maximized.

Reusability and recyclability - The whole product life-cycle (off-the-shelf modules, casting molds, plastic product parts and packaging) is designed with the recycling perspective within. Using recyclable and bio-degradable materials, clearly marking the part material for recycling and minimizing the waste is the key.

Sustainable materials - Carving the product design and functions around the already available off-the-shelf SW, HW and mechanical modules minimizes not just the product costs, but also the end to end environmental impact.

Environmentally friendly factories - With the small scale manufacturing in mind we have developed the SASS manufacturing method, which does not require high investment and operational costs and enables us to support local communities with local job creation.

Sustainable Distribution - Our SASS manufacturing method with focus on the local production reduces considerably the distribution environmental impact. Local manufacturing for local jobs for local communities with minimal global fulfillment logistical chains.

We, at FRACH robotics, believe the robotic revolution will only help us, when the robots are affordable to all of society and especially to their most vulnerable parts. 
We need Your help to deliver this new and exciting technology to the World! And we want You to be the first to have access to this technology, the Age of Robots.

Ellipso is also integrated with Google Assistant, Google Drive, Google Mail, YouTube and Microsoft Skype to let you stay in touch.
Ellipso design brings a large display to not only show just the robot's face, but also to show useful content on the screen, such as Google Assistant, YouTube or Skype. The robot is actively listening to all sounds and it automatically reacts to your verbal commands. Currently only English, but we will support other languages in the future.  
Ellipso comes with different personality profiles, faces and voices. But it is also fully customizable, if you are more on an artistic side. Ellipso remembers requests of different family members and also what happened in the past, so it behaves and provides specific feedback based on the situational and historical context.
Ellipso robot design includes the latest deep neural network frameworks for object and face detection to recognize you, your pets and other objects in your house. The robot uses optical recognition algorithms for understanding its location and map of your house, so it knows where is a kitchen, obstacles or a fall. Ellipso has also plenty of environmental sensors to fully understand what is happening in your house, such as people movements, sounds or alarms.  
 
Robot Behavior
The robot's role is not to replace your friends or pets, but rather to make your life easier. The robot will help you to stay in contact with your loved ones and automate tedious and boring tasks in your house.

Our robot products come with these default behavior tasks so you can specifically instruct them, at home or remotely, to focus on the right job:

 Personal companion - the robot will follow you in your house or look at you on a desk, ready to execute your commands. The robot will greet you from time to time and share the latest status with you. 
 Calling over Skype - you can ask the robot to call a person on Skype; from home or remotely. Or the robot will call you if it sees anything suspicious. 
 Search and share a message - you can remotely ask the robot to find your loved one (person or pet) in the house and deliver a message or take an action.
 Taking a picture - ask your robot to take a picture for a memorable moment and store it in the Google Cloud.
 Going somewhere - you can ask your robot to go to a specific room (e.g. a kitchen) and take an action there. 
 Google Assistant -  just ask the Google Assistant any tricky question you want. From weather to politics to science; or just for a joke.  
 Youtube - you can ask your robot to play Youtube content of your choice.
 Sharing the latest status - the robot will tell you how long you have been gone and what happened in your house in the meantime.
 Sharing the latest weather info and news - every morning and when asked the robot will share with you the latest local weather forecast and news.
 Teaching a foreign language -  the robot will teach you a foreign language, using simple, but effective active recall method. We start with Spanish, but more languages are coming. 
 Setting an alarm - ask your robot to wake you up when it is the right time. 
 Playing with pets - your pets can get a bit bored when they are left alone or perhaps you want to chat with them over Skype. Just ask your robot to be a messenger or entertainer. 
 Securing the property - be better safe than sorry. Our robots can watch your house for you when you are away and alarm you if they detect any suspicious sounds, movements or a human presence. Our robots store all the taken evidence in the Google Cloud and call you on Skype, so the bad guys will have a bad day whatever they do.  
 Robot administration - creating its own map of rooms and obstacles; watching its battery status and automatically recharging when due; or just endlessly waiting for you to come back.

Please do not worry if you are missing anything here. We will be releasing new functionality every 3 months. And we are going to listen to you on social media and our user forums to really understand your new requirements.  
 
Robot Customization
We, at FRACH robotics, understand that key to any successful product is a high level of customization for specific user needs and demands. We are all different and unique and therefore we require the same from our tools and gadgets. Our robotic technology supports comprehensive customization in both appearance and behavior. Our technology also supports user provided customization from our more DIY and artistically oriented customers.  


 Robot call name - the default robot call name is "COMPUTER", but feel free to change it to anything else.
 Robot personality profile customization - our robots come with plenty of different personality profiles so you can have fun every day: FRIEND, MEDIEVAL, TEENAGER, SERVANT, MILITARY, SCI-FI, ROMANTIC and obviously also your custom one. 
 Robot face customization - out of the box we provide 9 different faces for our robots, but feel welcome to upload your own creative designs.



 Robot voice -  you can chose tens of different voices, male/female speakers and different English accents. Later on our robots will also support other languages. 
 Robot behavior - you can customize hundreds of behavioral rules, how often the robot should interact with you or what particular activities to be temporarily disabled. 
 Face recognition - using the face recognition technology the robot is able to respond to each user with his/her own name and related history.   
 Tyres - we will provide a rich selection of internal/outdoors tyres with different colors, so you can take your robot out on a garden and do some "digging".

 
Robot Models
Our robot products come in 3 models to let our customers to choose the right tool for the job:    

 
Privacy and Security
We, at FRACH robotics, consider the security and privacy as the most important functionality of our products. It is paramount that your personal data are comprehensively protected as our robots are present in your homes. 

Our technology use strictly only secure publicly available services from major SW providers for all robot external communication. Such as Google Android OS, Google Drive, Google Android Voice Recognition, Google Mail and  Microsoft Skype. There is no other robot communication with our company servers or any other 3rd parties. Users are also able to explicitly disable any robot interfaces such as camera or microphone for maximum privacy. 
 
Robot App
 Obviously our robots will come with an app, both Google Android and Apple iOS.  

The app will enable you to connect and use your robot, when you leave your house. You can check the status of your robot, what action it is currently executing, its position in the house, see details of any security alerts and use the live Skype video/audio feed. Also it could be more comfortable to use the app to configure the robot's settings, instead of typing on the robot's screen or talking to it. 
 
Robot Design 



External shapes - Ellipso design is inspired by using a single geometrical shape (the ellipsoid) for the whole body and wheels, so the end result has a simple, but powerful and elegant impression.  

 Robot SW design - The robot's main control process is implemented as an Android long running background Service. The Service's thread cycles every 100ms and it implements integration with all external modules; such as camera, BlueTooth or Android's speech recognition API. The external modules translate their specific custom events to a generic logical language so the robotic brain model can simply analyse and command the robot based on the historical context and current events.  
 Robot brain model -  our robot brain cortex behavioral rules model is based on the “Affordance Competition Hypothesis” research of University of Montreal. This enables the robot to behave like it is alive and us to simply add new rules and behavior with minimal impact on the current ones. The same way a child would learn new behavioral patterns. 


 Robot Android AI frameworks - Google TensorFlow Lite deep neural networks for object detection (20 class yolo); Google FireBase ML framework for face/expression detection; OpenCV open sourced framework for face recognition. 

 Robot HW AI frameworks - HW accelerated Kendryte K210 deep neural network object detection and sound FFT to detect specific sound patterns (e.g. human voice or a fire alarm). 

 Robot SLAM mapping and navigation - "Fast Semi-Direct Monocular Visual Odometry" algorithm with IMU support to detect 3D obstacles and falls  based on research of University of Zurich; simultaneous localisation and mapping (SLAM) algorithm for robot's self-navigation and map generation.


 Robot HW capabilities - Android ARM quad/octa core 1300/2000 MHz CPU for high level cognitive behavior and integration with Cloud services; Kendryte K210 dual core 400/600 MHz CPU with dedicated deep neural networks HW acceleration (TensorFlow Lite) and FFT acceleration; ESP32 dual core 240 MHz CPU for Bluetooth, UART and GPIO connectivity. 
 Robot Android APIs - robot SW functionality and its behavior is tightly integrated with Android available public APIs and services. Such as Google Android Speech Recognition API; Google Android TextToSpeach API; Google Assistant and Google Youtube integration; Google Drive as Cloud based document storage; Google Mail as Cloud based communication API; Microsoft Skype as Cloud based IM service. 
 Robot sensors - 32/16/5MPx upward and 2MPx downward facing two cameras; GPS satellite position detection, two microphones with HW accelerated FFT; two 3W speakers; two Doppler radar modules for movement detection; red 5mW laser pointer, 3W RGB LED lights, 3W white LED lights, 6 DoF IMU with gyros and accelerators. 
 External connectivity - WiFi, Bluetooth, Android Cloud APIs. Our robots require only a standard Internet connectivity to access Google Mail, Google Drive and Microsoft Skype. No requirement to reconfigure your home or office WiFi routers to expose the IP ports or any other hassle. 
 SW API dependency - our robots are only dependent on publicly available free Google and Microsoft APIs. Therefore, there is no risk to the robots functionality if anything happens to our company servers.    
 Online SW updates - the robot's Android application (including its main behavioral rules and external interfaces) will be online updated every 3 months for new functionality and bug fixes; using Google Play market.   
 No monthly charges - there are no monthly or other charges for using our robots. Have a fun and enjoy the robot every day.
 Self-charging - our robots automatically monitor status of their batteries and when the charge is low the robot will automatically locate and recharge itself in a docking station. The robot can operate about 4h on a single charge when actively working; about 12h on standby with radar movement detection enabled.       
 Obstacle and voids detection - when on a table or facing down a staircase the robot will automatically detect dangerous voids (using the visual odometry algorithm) and reverse back. 
 User replaceable batteries - users can simply replace the robot's 18650 Li-ion batteries with minimal effort (2 x 2800mAh 18650 Li-ion cells). The batteries should last about 1 year if you use the robot every day.     
 4x4 all wheel drive - all wheel drive is a necessary design choice to support good locomotion across long hair carpets, floor bumps and clothing left on floor.

 Noise suppression - geared motors generated noise will be significantly reduced by 3 levels of sound insulation: geared motors rubber enclosure, rubber belt transmission to wheels and rubber tires.   

 DIY customization and hacking SDK - our robots comprehensively broadcast their status using Android Intents to support integration with the 3rd party custom applications and hacks. So you can extend the robot's behavior for your own custom actions and integrate it with your apps.  

  
Our Products Pipeline
The plan below shows our product pipeline for next 3 years. Ellipso, Barrel and Globe robots are our generic designs; Blocker (compatible with major brick play-sets), Froggy and Cubby robots are models for children; and in 2022 we want to introduce our first soft robot Gripper and also a robot drone FastAir. 

 
Delivery Timeline
It has been a long journey, but now we, at FRACH robotics, have a great and exciting technology ready to be shared with You:

 
Total Quality Control
We, at FRACH robotics, are obsessed with quality control of our products. Based on the IT industry DevOps best practices the continues multi-level testing with fully automated 24/7 regression is necessary to deliver stable, functional and long-term reliable products. Majority of the automated test cycles will run at least every 24h and each identified defect will be required to be fixed immediately.
 
Functional behavioral testing - unit testing of the brain behavioral rules in JVM to assure a proper sequencing and habituation of the behavioral actions; unit testing of interface modules in JVM; virtual functional testing of the assembled robot in the virtual environment; environmental functional testing in real habitats.
None-functional electronic testing - unit testing of the off-the-shelf electronic modules (e.g. geared motors) before assembly; power consumption, endurance and self-charging testing; electronic interference testing. 
None-functional mechanical testing - unit testing of mechanical parts before assembly; mechanical functional stress, falls, vibrations and endurance testing; noise generation testing on different surfaces. 
User acceptance testing - testing the robot behavior and user interactions with small focus groups to assess simplicity, effectiveness and usability of the robot's user interfaces; both vocal and screen UIs.
 
Small Scale Production
Small scale production of electronic gadgets has been always a concern for its high investment and operational costs. For example, the high-quality steel plastic injection molds for a small robot can easily cost upto £100000. Therefore we, at FRACH robotics, have developed the SASS (Smart Agile Small Scale) method to minimize the costs, focus on fast delivery of the business value to our customers and risk mitigation at it's core. Our SASS method covers comprehensively all aspects of design, manufacturing, testing and fulfillment and it is strongly inspired by the IT industry best practices such as Agile, DevOps and Micro-services.  
 


3D design - using inexpensive 3D CAD SW, such as FreeCAD or AUTODESK Fusion 360.

 Off-the-shelf HW design - component design based on reusing currently manufactured and easily sourced modules such as Android devices, geared motors, common DIY electronic modules, rubber transmission belts, etc. Focus on sourcing from multiple channels to minimize dependency risks and costs.   

 Off-the-shelf SW design - robot SW functionality and its behavior is tightly integrated with Android available public APIs and services. Such as Google Android speech recognition API, Google Android TextToSpeach API, Google Assistant, Google Youtube, Google Drive, Google Mail and Microsoft Skype. This design approach significantly extends robot's capabilities, but reduces the costs. 

 Rapid prototyping - using FDM 3D printers with 0.8mm nozzles for fast and 0.4 nozzles for more precise plastic parts prototyping; with PLA plastic for low environmental impact and recyclability. 

 Rapid mold patterns - using SLA/DLP 3D printers with UV resins to achieve high quality mold patterns with 50 microns resolution.

 Rubber plastic injection molds - using RTV silicone and thermoplastic PVC rubbers for inexpensive and recyclable injection molds; reinforced with fiberglass threads. 

 Aluminium plastic injection molds - using inexpensive aluminium mold production technique based on the sequence: SLA 3D printed mold pattern / rubber mold / refractory plaster mold / vacuum assisted melted aluminium mold; where the aluminium molds can be also used directly in the plastic injection molding machines. Also with the benefit of aluminium recycling.  

 Polyurethane plastics - low viscosity vacuum assisted injection molding without expensive injection molding machines for low production volumes. Adding chopped glass fibers for extra strength, durability and crack resistance.

 Outsourced plastic injection molding - renting local available capacity and using low cost aluminium molds for standard plastic injection molding for medium production volumes.

 Outsourced electronic PCB manufacturing and assembly - using online outsourced services, where a PCB is manufactured, assembled and delivered in 4 weeks. See bellow an example from our main PCB manufacturing partner; Seeed Studio.




 Self-assembling design - designing both plastic and electronic PCB parts to simplify, mechanically guide and speed up the assembly of the final product with focus on mitigation of wrong direction/parts assembly. 

 Batch assembly - using mass production techniques introduced by H. Ford to break down complex assembly processes to tens of simple assembly steps, which can be executed in batches of 100s. 

 ISO quality - quality method focused on reproducibility, where the assembler is provided with visual and video description of each simple assembly step and with all required assembly tooling. So, the assembly batch is executed in the continuously same quality and productivity. 

 SW Agile, DevOps and Micro-services - using the IT industry SW development best practices to continuously analyse, develop, test, deploy and assess business feedback in short monthly cycles. Breaking down complex SW packages to small components with defined interfaces to simplify, parallelize and de-risk the SW development. Totally automating repeatable processes, such as build, test and deploy.

 Agile delivery of the business value - iteratively deliver the latest functionality and bugfixes to the customer base every few months over the Internet.    

 Outsourced fulfillment - outsourcing fulfillment of the end product to global efficient professionals to minimize costs and environmental impact. Prefer local over global.  

 Customer feedback - support multi-channel customer feedback on social media and forums to truly understand customer wishes, desires and new trends. Involving the customer base in selection of new functionality, capabilities and products. Running small focus groups for simple and inexpensive product marketing research and product capabilities assessment. 

 Research & development - staying on the top of the latest University research and following the latest open sourced technologies from major SW companies. 

 
Prototyping
Agile delivery methods require a short iteration life-cycle of analyses, design, test, user feedback and improvement. It is necessary to innovate, test and accept/reject all parts of the design in fast and fine granular matter to maximize business value, mitigate delivery, quality and user acceptance risks and minimize the development, production and product costs. On the picture below you can see history of our prototyping cycle for last 2 years.  

 
Research & Development
We, at FRACH robotics, are fascinated with a prospect of having inexpensive humanoid robots at our homes. However to achieve this goal we need to first develop animalistic type of robot locomotion and also inexpensive and human safe robot muscles. As we are closely following the latest university research in these areas we believe we can develop our first soft-robot product (Gripper) in next 2 years. 
Utrecht University and University of British Columbia research of muscle based control with neural delay to simulate bio-mechanical constraints: 

Google DeepMind AI research of walking bi-pods using self-learning deep neural networks: 

Cornell University research of soft robotic muscles:

Harvard University research of small soft robots:



 
FRACH Robotics Team
We are a robotic start-up focused on advanced autonomous robotic technologies to be present in our homes. Turning our technology dreams into main stream consumer products. We believe that with Your help we can start the robotic revolution and take the human kind to next level ... the Age of Robots.
 Damian Frach MSc, MBA - founder, business and technical strategy; product development; design, development and manufacturing processes; logistics; programme management
 Katerina Frach BSc - founder; market research; product marketing; customer community development; quality assurance; customer care; fulfillment; finance and accounting
 Jerome Josephraj BSc - adviser; Entrepreneurship; Java Enterprise technologies; Cloud; full SW development life-cycle; Agile and DevOps delivery methods; test-driven and behavior-driven SW development
 Jonas Allemann MSc - adviser; advanced mathematics, 3D modelling and visualizations; simultaneous localisation and mapping
 Jack Cowling MSc - adviser; advanced mathematics; artificial intelligence; deep neural networks

 
Risks and Challenges
Capital Investment - mitigated by our small scale production SASS delivery method, which enables small and medium manufactures to avoid high investment costs in tooling and machinery.
Design complexity - mitigated by using off the shelf SW , HW and mechanical modules in our designs. Significant reduction of complexity and costs and improvement of reliability and quality of our products.
Sourcing - mitigated by using off the shelf modules from multiple manufactures and sale channels to avoid single point of failure in our sourcing. Sourcing competition also significantly reduces the costs.
Quality - mitigated by continues 24/7 test automation of all aspects of functional and none functional scope. This enables 100% daily regression quality assurance and detection of any long term issues.
Privacy, security and dependency - mitigated by using only Google and Microsoft public Cloud services with no dependency or content share with FRACH robotics servers.
Product functionality - mitigated by listening to our customer base on the social media and our forums for new requirements, trends, issues and concerns. Releasing new functionality every 3 months.
 
Environmental Commitments
Long-lasting design - Reinforced plastic parts, regular online SW updates and user replaceable batteries assure our products life-span is maximized.
Reusability and recyclability - The whole product life-cycle (off-the-shelf modules, casting molds, plastic product parts and packaging) is designed with the recycling perspective within. Using recyclable and bio-degradable materials, clearly marking the part material for recycling and minimizing the waste is the key.
Sustainable materials - Carving the product design and functions around the already available off-the-shelf SW, HW and mechanical modules minimizes not just the product costs, but also the end to end environmental impact.
Environmentally friendly factories - With the small scale manufacturing in mind we have developed the SASS manufacturing method, which does not require high investment and operational costs and enables us to support local communities with local job creation.
Sustainable Distribution - Our SASS manufacturing method with focus on the local production reduces considerably the distribution environmental impact. Local manufacturing for local jobs for local communities with minimal global fulfillment logistical chains.

story_txt: Hi

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
A Juvenile Products Manufacturers Association
Innovation Awards Finalist

 

 

Easily Preventable, But Still a Problem

 

Electrical outlets are as much a neccessity for our day-to-day lives as they can be a danger to our children at home.

It's shocking to find that, in a society of such advanced technology, the number of accidents involving children tampering with electrical outlets are staggering.

Every year, around 2,400 children are injured while sticking hairpins, keys, paper clips, even their fingers, or other small items into the slots of electrical outlets. In fact, 6 to 12 of these easily preventable accidents prove fatal each year.

 

When Covering is not Enough... and May Actually Present More Risk

 

The most common solution to this problem are known as receptacle caps or covers; created with the purpose of closing or blocking off outlets not currently in use by an appliance or device. However, these receptacle caps are often misplaced and may in fact become a choking hazard to small children. Not to mention that, according to a study by Temple University, 37 children ages 2 to 4, took an average of 39 seconds to remove these covers. Children can simply repeat this process, after watching their parents remove the covers, without understanding the consequences.


 

The Easy and Reliable Way to Keep your Children Safe

 

I’m delighted to present to you SAFETY SOCKETS, an adapter that easily plugs into a regular wall socket and instantly turns it into a tamper-resistant socket that you can feel safe about and rely on. Unlike regular Tamper-Resistant Receptacles, SAFETY SOCKETS does not have removable covers that children could easily tamper with or choke on. Also, SAFETY SOCKETS are specially designed to prevent the insertion of any object into any individual slot and will not open unless both bars of a plug are pressed at the same time — just as it should be.


 

The Inexpensive and Instant Solution

 

In the U.S., 46 states now require most new buildings to use tamper-resistant outlets. However, it is very likely you may not already have tamper-resistant outets installed in your home, and replacing all or even some of these outlets can be quite expensive.
You'll be happy to know that SAFETY SOCKETS are an affordable and easy to use alternative — you can purchase SAFETY SOCKETS for each outlet you'd like to protect and easily install them, without having to replace the existing outlets or paying for expensive installation services.


 

SAFETY SOCKETS are extremely easy to install. In under a minute, you can have a new tamper-resistant outlet installed and forget about it — giving you peace of mind knowing you're protected. SAFETY SOCKETS provide the gold standard in child safety when it comes to electrical outlets as defined by the National Electric Code while providing the convenience of a simple plug in or screw in solution.

 

 

Two Types of SAFETY SOCKETS

 

Because there are generally two types of electrical outlets in the U.S. — Type A (with just two pins, frequently found in older homes) and Type B (with two flat parallel pins and a ground pin) — there are also two types of SAFETY SOCKETS made to suit whichever type of outlet you have at home.




 

Daycares and Schools: Here’s the Perfect Childproof Electrical Outlet Device
I have designed SAFETY SOCKETS with daycares and schools in mind. After all, statistics show that one in three parents do not know whether the daycare or school their child attends have child-proof electrical outlets. The truth is that many of these institutions may lack this protection. SAFETY SOCKETS are the easiest and fastest way to allow educational facilities to be ensure the safety of all children in literally less than one minute.

 

 

The Story Behind SAFETY SOCKETS

 

It's a short but easily relatable one. I am an electrical engineer and recently became a grandfather; so I'm sure you'll understand my motivation. As a grandfather, I have always noticed how hazardous unprotected electrical sockets can be for children. As an electrical engineer, my problem-solving skills allowed me to invent an affordable and easy to use solution; one that kids couldn't overcome or tamper with, and offers true peace of mind to families. I'm proud to introduce SAFETY SOCKETS, a device that any family would benefit from.

 

I hope you'll help me turn SAFETY SOCKETS into a reality.

 

 

Where SAFETY SOCKETS Stands

 

We currently have a fully developed, working prototype of SAFETY SOCKETS. However, we need to raise $15,000 to purchase the three plastic injection molds necessary, and begin manufacturing.

story:
THE STORY

The idea came 18 months ago when every time I visited a restaurant I needed a toothpick after eating. When I collected toothpicks and stored them in my wallet I ALWAYS seemed to run out and was left with that uncomfortable feeling of food being stuck in my teeth. 

Time and time again we eat food and get something stuck in our teeth. Time and time again we don't have the right product at hand to deal with this situation. Until now!

Pick-iTi has been created for all those people that need a quick fix to a long lasting problem. Whether that be to clean your teeth before meeting someone or to simply to open a bottle of beer to share with friends. Pick-iTi has you covered!!

 

THE PRODUCT

The name Pick-iTi comes from three elements; it has the function of a toothPICK which is the basis of the design, the need to pick iT when using the product solidifies the idea that it can be used for a whole aray of functions, finally Ti is the periodical symbol for Titanium. Being made from 100% Grade 5 titanium helps to subtly explain what the product is without having to ask too many questions. 

If I reach my Stretch Goal of $20,000 I intend to incorporate color into the picks such as Matt Black, Matt Silver and special Anodizing Pick-iTis.  If the funding continues, incorporation of different sizes whilst retaining Pick-iTis unique shape will be the aim. 

Fulfilling orders in our #1 priority. 

 

THE SPECIFICATION

 

Weight: 3.0grams

Length: 70mm

Thickness: 10mm

Material: Titanium

Color: Silver

 

THE RISKS & CHALLANGES

Some of the biggest risks involved with this project are getting the product to our backers on time. However we intend to put our passion into fulfilling orders and making this our Number one priority, we will do everything possible so our backers get the rewards. 

We are now ready to spread the word of Pick-iTi and take it to the next level of mass production, we will make sure to be transparent with each step of the process.

story:
Introduction

Snug Energy is a home automation hub which monitors and helps control your electricity, gas and water consumption. This is made possible through the hub continuously reading consumption levels and transmitting that data (through your home Wi-Fi connection) to our cloud based platform - which then relays the real time data to your digital TV and mobile device. The hub also enables remote adjustment of your home's thermostat in response to weather conditions.

Cloud Connected Real Time Data


Remote Temperature Adjustment


Comparing and Sharing

Another feature of our product is the ability to compare your consumption profile to that of other users as well as share your data (and we hope efficiency progress) on social media - that way we can all become more aware of our environmental footprints!

Comparing and Sharing


Development

We have an amazing team who have spent the last 2 years designing, developing, prototyping and testing the hardware and associated software. We have interfaced with commercial protocols such as Wi-Fi, wireless M-bus, Zigbee, Infra Red, Enocean and Bluetooth to provide a fully resolved and integrated solution. 

Functioning Protocols

Below are some images of the earlier stages of our progress to give an indication of how far we have come.

Concept


Engineering


The Journey


Functioning Prototype


Finalized Enclosure


Deployment and Testing

We have installed and trialed the Snug Energy hub in test homes in Australia and Ireland with fantastic results. Installation of the sender units has proven to be relatively straight forward with the data captured providing amazing insights into the ebb and flow of daily household activity.

Being the Change

Please join us in our quest of utilising technology as an enabler for good by supporting our Indiegogo campaign. The Snug Energy team will keep you regularly updated of our progress right here on Indiegogo as well as on our website and social media pages:

www.facebook.com/snugenergy

www.twitter.com/snugenergy

www.snugenergy.com

Risks and Challenges

Thanks for getting this far on our campaign page! 

We are super excited about the project and if we gain enough support we will be even more excited about you joining us in our efficiency and climate quest! 

As with any new product, the conceptual design, engineering, testing, manufacturing and commercialization process can be a huge task. We are very lucky though. The engineering and senior management team at Snug Energy have done all of this before (including with really large well-known companies). We appreciate that the commitment to an Indiegogo Perk is a vote of confidence and we will do absolutely everything possible to exceed your expectations in terms of product quality, robustness, ease of use, final delivery and end user enjoyment.

Actually the biggest risk we see is at your end of this process (sorry!). Every building or home can be a little different and all can have their own quirky characteristics. We have tried to overcome obstacles by making the product very simple to install and by using only proven industry leading components and protocols.

The small, wireless current transducer (CT) clamp which clips over the main electricity cable coming into the home (usually in a hallway or utility cupboard) is a self-installation device. It only takes about a minute and it will start communicating with your Snug Energy hub immediately!

In the homes we have installed the thermostat switch in, it has taken no more than 10 minutes. We recommend a budget for this of US$40 in call out charges if you are not comfortable/capable of doing it yourself.

The worst case scenario is that you will still have the smart energy hub connected via Wi-Fi and a thermostat switch which will give you remote access to heating/cooling and all of the data via your phone even when you are not home. 

In the homes we have installed the water meter, it has taken no more than 40 minutes. The attached wireless module will start communicating with the Snug Energy hub straight away. We recommend a budget for this of US$70 in call out charges.

If you have both the thermostat and the water meter to be fitted, we would recommend talking to a local contractor who would most likely be able to do both pretty quickly in one visit and in less than an hour total. In this situation, we found a number were willing to do it for US$100 on the single trip.

The Snug Energy hub will need to be connected to your home Wi-Fi to be fully operational.

We will make sure to keep you fully informed at all stages during our manufacturing process (at a minimum on a monthly basis with detailed reports, technical updates etc.) should this campaign be successful. We will also upload some instructional videos onto our Facebook and YouTube pages in advance of shipping. We want you to enjoy our product and to be satisfied that you really are making a difference in a positive way to our planet.

We will make sure to support you along the way until your purchase is up and running, to show our appreciation for the support that you are giving us now.

If you have any further questions or concerns that are not addressed here or in the Details/FAQ sections, please get in contact with us.

Thanks!

story:
The Smart Letterbox is the first invented device that detects the presence of a letter and parcel and interacts with its user and surrounding autonomously.

The Smart Letterbox is built on the basics of artificial intelligence to tackle challenges encountered in letter and parcel delivery such as no notification of the presence of letters, undelivered letter and parcel due to absence of addressee, letter damage and theft.



DESIGNS AVAILABLE


The Smart Letterbox SEL App allows the addressee to communicate with the Post man at the point of delivery. Such as to authorize the delivery of First class letters or parcels.

The Smart Letterbox saves you the time and energy of going to check for letters and parcels


EASY TO USE AND HAZARD FREE

The Smart Letterbox can be setup with the manual attached in its package. It is easy to use and doesn't endager its users and surrounding. The Smart Letterbox can be used at home and the office.

OPEN TO NEW IDEAS

The Smart Letterbox was designed with upgrade opportunity in mind. We will open up communication media to enable interaction. Businesses  and developers who wish to contribute new ideas can contact us at: viretigroup@gmail.com

INVENTORS AND THE TEAM

The Smart Letterbox was invented by Rufus as a final year project. Rufus graduated with a First Class in Electrical and Electronic Engineering from the University of East London. After successfully demonstrating the prototype of the Smart Letterbox to lecturers in the University of East London . Rufus was invited to a technology Showcase at the University of East London. 

Mario Karagiorgis is a Co-founder of the Smart Letterbox.

Our individual interest to  invent has been the pillar of our relationship.

We are both motivated to develop new products that will make life easy and impact the world positively.

HELP MAKE IT HAPPEN

The reasons for this campaign is to:
1. Increase productivity and create required awareness
2. Purchase a working space in targeted areas
3. Manufacture and Install a minimum of 200 products within the next 12 months.

4. Create a Website

Finally, this campaign will help us to raise enough funds needed to successfully grow the brand SEL.

Please we ask that you contribute and share this campaign.

story:
Beautifully Designed Puzzle Toys - Great For Home Decor - Toys - Collection

  • Would you like your kids to play with toys that help them expand their creativity?
  • Do you want your kids to play with toys that make them smarter while having lots of fun?
  • Are you bored of your old home decor? 
  • Do you want to update your home and make it look more elegant?

If your answer to any of these questions above was yes, then these amazing Press2Fit Puzzle Toys will give you exactly what you need!

Check Out Some Of The Best White Chipboard Puzzle Toys That Can't Wait To Get Into Your Hands!



EFFORTLESS ASSEMBLY: These puzzle toys are made of 1.5mm white chipboard and the pieces are individually slotted to interlock with one another to form a 3D model.

SAVE TIME-NO NEED TO CUT THEM OR USE GLUE: Everything is pre-cut and assembled by pushing the pieces together. Pop out the pieces and go!

UNLIMITED FUN: Kids will love these amazing toys. If you are looking for an alternative way of entertainment - beyond mind numbing TV and video games - you have just found it!

PERFECT GIFT IDEA: Do you want to buy an economical but mind blowing gift? 

These puzzle toys will give you the most bang for your buck. Separate yourself from the crowd of people who buy generic and boring gifts. Give your friends, kids or relatives a chance to love you and appreciate your gift!

        

                                       



CHECK HOW EASY IT IS - EVEN A BABY CAN DO IT:

  

 Here Is Your Chance To Become a Member In The Most  Fascinating Toy Making Revolution Of 21st Century 
And Be THE FIRST WHO GETS THEM

These puzzle toys are laser cut and in order to produce them we need a laser cutter.

A professional laser cutter costs from 8000 (the one we will buy) to prices you cant even imagine.So the campaign goal is set to 10000 and this amount will help us pay for the materials and the laser cutter only.

As you can understand we will get no cash in our hands but only a machine so that we can open a creative bussiness that will provide you value. And give you the most creative and fun toys-home decor solutions.

Here is What You Will Get - And You Can Get It For The Cost of a T-Shirt:

Carefully packaged one of a kind pop out laser cut puzzle toys that can be assembeled in less than 5 minutes due to the unique circular assembly process.

How These Puzzle Toys Can Have a Positive Impact On You And Others

  • Boost your creativity and expand your mental horizons
  • Add a touch of classyness to your place with the most uniquely designed Puzzle Toys.
  • Support our environment - Press2Fit Puzzle Toys are 100% recycled and environmental friendly!
  • Due to the circular assembly process we achieve at least 95% less use of material compared to a plastic toy of the same size and that is a huge impact on the environment
  • Get THE BEST VALUE by supporting QUALITY toys that are offered in the MOST ECONOMICAL PRICE on the market.

Even more remarcable is that our Puzzles can reach dimensions such as 35cm in length and 28cm in height but they only weight less than a small phone and that makes them safe for all ages.

Support us and be a part of our revolutionary family.Thanks in advance

                       Hassle Free - No Risk Involved

There are no actual risks.We have finished all the packaging and product files and they are ready to be cut and sent to you.

There will be no shipping delays for your Puzzles.

If we don't reach our goal for 10.000 euros you have an 100%MONEY BACK GUARANTEE. 

Spread The Word By Sharing This Project With Your Friends And Loved Ones

We know that some of cant help us with money but that doesnt mean you cant help us at all.There are a few things you can do to support us and help us bring this project to life.

For exampe:

  • You can post our campaign on your facebook,twitter,pinterest etc.
  • Inform people you know that will be interested on our puzzle toys,like a parent,a teacher or a Puzzle enthusiast with a personal message!

And that's all there is to it.

THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING!!!!
